items.title: nixos/monetdb: Init nixos test

items.content_html:
Description of changes

Follow up of #237425 (comment) .

WIP, creating it ahead of time just to have a reference when cloing other issues

Goal is to simplify the configuration of neovim. Right now we have several mechanisms to configure: override, wrapNeovim, makeNeovimConfig the latter being introduced by me but never documented as it didn't feel right. With the finalAttrs pattern we finally have self-documented parameters: launch a nix repl and explore neovim attributes, you can change them via overrideAttrs and they will automatically be taken into account.

And we can get rid of makeNeovimConfig: we can expose everything in the wrapper derivation: user customRc, the generatedRc etc. No need to find back the correct setting in the override call to adjust something down the line.
makeNeovimConfig will be kept for 23.11, not sure if it's going to be deprecated, depends how much time I can dedicate to this basically.

Things done

items.title: neovim: heavy refactor

items.content_html:
Description of changes

This PR fixes two issues with the bundled treesitter parsers (introduced in #227159):

  1. The parsers are outdated and fail with latest nvim-treesitter plugin. (e.g. release date of tree-sitter-c is August 2022)
  2. The parsers are already defined in vimPlugins.
  3. Changing the parsers causes a rebuild of neovim-unwrapped.
  4. Parsers are not needed to build neovim-unwrapped.
  5. In case of problems with bundled the parser, I did not expect, a parser was bundled with neovim-unwrapped

This PR moves the parsers from neovim-unwrapped derivation to the neovim (wrapped) and reuses the parsers in vimPlugins.

items.title: neovim.rubyEnv: fix cross

items.content_html:
Motivation for this change

Pass the wrapRc option through so it's usable from the neovim package exposed by pkgs/top-level/all-packages.nix. I needed this to maintain some degree of backward compatibility for my setup, so I thought it'd be better pushed upstream. IIRC, there are a few more options that could easily be exposed but aren't, and I could fish these out if we want a more complete PR.

Things done
  • Tested using sandboxing (nix.useSandbox on NixOS, or option sandbox in nix.conf on non-NixOS linux)
  • Built on platform(s)
    • NixOS

items.title: nixos-infra jitsi prep

items.content_html:
Description of changes

Initialises a VM Test for Ustreamer, and updates the ustreamer package in Nixpkgs. This is a port of the VM Test defined in pikvm/ustreamer#136 since upstream do not want a Nix flake as their build system. I also intend to nixify more pikvm related software in the future.

items.title: nixos/tests/ustreamer: init

items.content_html:
Description of changes

In #269477, the Gatus package was added to nixpkgs. I created a NixOS module to run Gatus as a Systemd service. I have been running this myself for a week with no problems. You can see on my personal Git server how this can be used: here I define Gatus endpoints which are services I monitor, and here I configure the service itself.

This is my first contribution to nixpkgs so any comments are greatly appreciated!

items.title: nixos/gatus: init module

items.content_html:
Description of changes

create a module to use qbitTorrent as a service.

blocking issues

  • sufficient testing ( some testing is done, imo not enough.)
  • serverConfig
    • gendeepINI gets a fitting type to use for this option.
      qBittorrent from editing the config file if we want to define it ourselves.
    • qBittorrent.conf can be set as a symlink in the given location without being overwritten by the program. ( done with 1 sticky bit, this behaviour in qBittorrent of overwriting the path is annoying, but this deals with it well enough )
  • openFirewall
  • release notes entry ( currently unsure on formatting)

nice to haves

  • a better way to set CapabilityBoundingSet to restrict all.
  • an explanation for PrivateTmp being disabled upstream. ( qbittorrent/qBittorrent#6806 (comment) )
  • some way to generate the bizare password format used.

notes

for service hardening I don't believe any of the following can be used simply because of the services purpose.
IPAddressDeny PrivateNetwork or restriction of AF_NETLINK AF_INET or AF_INET6 address families.
ProtectSystem cant be used without entirely declarative config

in my previous attempt at this here i was advised to simply make use of the service from the package, I'm unsure how to do this.
I started with an aim to follow https://github.com/qbittorrent/qBittorrent/blob/master/dist/unix/systemd/qbittorrent-nox%40.service.in I don't understand why it sets PrivateTmp to false however and have otherwise changed it significantly with service hardening and nix(os) specifics.

testing so far has been taken from #279716
Likely to replace once I figure the testing framework myself.

  • Tested compilation of all packages that depend on this change using nix-shell -p nixpkgs-review --run "nixpkgs-review rev HEAD". Note: all changes have to be committed, also see nixpkgs-review usage
  • Tested basic functionality of all binary files (usually in ./result/bin/)
  • 24.05 Release Notes (or backporting 23.05 and 23.11 Release notes)

    • (Module updates) Added a release notes entry if the change is significant

items.content_html:
Description of changes

Add partlabel option to mount devices by partition label and updated the documentation for label and partlabel to minimise future confusion. Motivated by #271731

Things done

  • Built on platform(s)
    • x86_64-linux
    • aarch64-linux
    • x86_64-darwin
    • aarch64-darwin
  • For non-Linux: Is sandboxing enabled in nix.conf? (See Nix manual)
    • sandbox = relaxed
    • sandbox = true
  • Tested, as applicable:
    • NixOS test(s) (look inside nixos/tests)
    • and/or package tests
    • or, for functions and "core" functionality, tests in lib/tests or pkgs/test
